graph

Interface Graph<T>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Traversal<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdjacencyGraph

    public interface Graph<T>
    An interface defining the functionality required of graphs. You should not modify this code. Instead implement graph(s) as separate classes.
    Version:
    November 2019
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(T node)
      Add a node to the graph.
      void add(T start, T end)
      Add an edge to the graph.
      boolean contains(T node)
      Check if the graph contains a given node.
      boolean contains(T start, T end)
      Check if the graph contains a given edge between two nodes.
      java.util.Set<T> getNeighbours(T node)
      Get the neighbours of a given node.
      java.util.Set<T> getNodes()
      Get all the nodes in the graph.
      int getNoOfEdges()
      Get the number of edges in the graph.
      int getNoOfNodes()
      Get the number of nodes in the graph.
      void remove(T node)
      Remove a node, and all edges leading to and from it, from the graph.
      void remove(T start, T end)
      Remove an edge from the graph.

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        boolean contains(T node)
        Check if the graph contains a given node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be checked.
        Returns:
        (node is a node in the graph).

      • contains

        boolean contains(T start,
                 T end)
        Check if the graph contains a given edge between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        start - the start node of the edge to be checked.
        end - the end node of the edge to be checked.
        Returns:
        (there is an edge from start to end in the graph).

      • add

        void add(T node)
  throws GraphError
        Add a node to the graph.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be added.
        Throws:
        GraphError - if the node is already in the graph.

      • remove

        void remove(T node)
     throws GraphError
        Remove a node, and all edges leading to and from it, from the graph.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be removed - all edges leaving the node, and all edges entering the node will also be deleted.
        Throws:
        GraphError - if the node does not exist.

      • add

        void add(T start,
         T end)
  throws GraphError
        Add an edge to the graph.
        Parameters:
        start - the start node of the edge to be added.
        end - the end node of the edge to be added.
        Throws:
        GraphError - if the edge already exists, or if either start or end is not a node in the graph

      • remove

        void remove(T start,
            T end)
     throws GraphError
        Remove an edge from the graph.
        Parameters:
        start - the start node of the edge to be removed.
        end - the end node of the edge to be removed.
        Throws:
        GraphError - if there is no such edge in this graph

      • getNeighbours

        java.util.Set<T> getNeighbours(T node)
                        throws GraphError
        Get the neighbours of a given node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node for which the neighbours should be found.
        Returns:
        a set of the immediate successors of the node.
        Throws:
        GraphError - if the node is not a node in the graph

      • getNoOfNodes

        int getNoOfNodes()
        Get the number of nodes in the graph.
        Returns:
        the number of nodes currently in this graph

      • getNodes

        java.util.Set<T> getNodes()
        Get all the nodes in the graph.
        Returns:
        a set containing all the nodes in this graph

      • getNoOfEdges

        int getNoOfEdges()
        Get the number of edges in the graph.
        Returns:
        the number of edges currently in this graph
